page.title: 11Recreation in Sebergham 1
page.content: The area is in the centre of the Cumberland Farmers' Foxhounds Saturday country and both Dentonside Wood and Ninegills are excellent foxholding coverts. The hounds meet three times a week between September and March and are keenly followed by many local people on foot, on horses and from cars. The River Caldew is a cold river and does not have a very plentiful supply of natural food. The brown trout are reasonably plentiful and grow to a good size due to the lack of competition from numbers. It is a difficult river to fish in this area as it runs through forests and has thickly wooded banks which make casting difficult. However it is a sporting river and much valued by true sporting fishermen.
